revised_title: David Willis Wilson Henderson's Contributions to Immunology and Bacteriology
tldr: David Willis Wilson Henderson was a prominent scientist who made significant contributions to the fields of immunology and bacteriology. He conducted research on pathogenic spore-bearing anaerobes, focusing on their antigens and the development of vaccines. His work on active and passive immunity, as well as his investigations into the cultivation of louping-ill virus, helped advance the understanding of bacterial antigens and the development of antibacterial prophylaxis.
